text: You could totally do this all from one table. Create dynamic pages at /venues , /book  and /thank-you. The path would be relative to each page so /venues/venue1 , /book/venue1, etc. Or you could just use a template that looks at query params.
you can create multiple dynamic pages all using the same table? nice! didn't know that
I will definitely look into this for the next time.  For now, keeping everything on one page actually ended up making more sense
Any chance of getting a file selector option some time down the road?

Hello HubDB geniuses. I'm having a challenge querying my DB via URL. Here is my code. I want to use a url like this - <http://www-feg-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/feg-peopl?subteam=Institutional%20Business%20Development>
I can't seem to get it to work. Any guidance would be much appreciated.
You should set the queryparam before you get the table rows
